title: Human Resources Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at HealthPartners
Interview Descriptions: Three interviews. First one was recruiter then second was hiring manager then team interview as well. Very easy and conversational style with some siiitutatioinal questoins such as 'tell me a time when'.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you had issues with another coworker.

title: Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at HealthPartners
Interview Descriptions: It was very smooth and everything went well. We had three rounds of interview. I asked many questions and everyone was so engaging. We talked about job and job responsibility.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? Wlhat are your strength?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was great and included a shadow portion. The managers were friendly and exuded confidence and joy. The employees were friendly and welcoming! The interview felt conversational with insertion of typical interview questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you made a difference for a patient.

title: Health Care Insurance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Saint Paul, MN)
Interview Descriptions: After waiting a few weeks, with no response to interview standing and many calls straight to voicemail. I was informed (after reaching out again) that they had continued to interview for an extra 3 weeks without informing us. I was very disappointed and unappreciative of the time wasted on waiting for a response about the job.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions started off just getting to know me, my experience, and my interest in the Job I was applying for.

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at HealthPartners
Interview Descriptions: My interview consisted of two rounds with two different sets of engineers/managers on the team. It was casual and conversational, but did cover a fairly in-depth set of technical questions.
Interview Questions: What do you like to do in your free time?

title: Test Architect Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at HealthPartners
Interview Descriptions: Process consisted of an initial phone screening with recruiter, then second interview with hiring manger. Only concern I had was the role they described did not match the job description they posted. Not really anything to do with testing at all, more RPA and solutions level.
Interview Questions: How would you take data from a pdf and enter it into a database?

title: Clinic Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Minneapolis, MN) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Had 3 rounds of interviews. First two were phone interviews and the third was in office. Loved how flexible the interviews were and it was such a great learning experience.
Interview Questions: What future can you see with having this position?

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at HealthPartners
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a multi-stage process of meeting key individuals and leaders in the Marketing area to understand the role and be interviewed. It was a great process with amazing people.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this role?

title: Quality Assurance Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process was during COVID19:
- 30 min phone call with HealthPartners recruiter
- 30 min virtual meeting with hiring manager
- 1 hr virtual meeting with hiring manager and other members on the team
Interview Questions:
- 30 min phone call with HealthPartners recruiter
Basic introductions and questions about your professional experience/background
- 30 min virtual meeting with hiring manager
Behavioral questions and in depth of your resume
- 1 hr virtual meeting with hiring manager and other members on the team
Behavioral/technical questions with scenarios, go over your skill sets and technology tools you've used or learned

title: Systems Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Houston, TX) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: I applied for systems engineer position at healthpartners in Nov 2020 and after three rounds of interview an offer has been made. It started of with phone interview with recruiting manager
Interview Questions: How would you fit for this role

title: Member Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: They were extremely friendly and willing incite to on what the job would be like on the regular. They were also very flexible on the time and day that you would meet for the interviews.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current job?

title: Marketing Planner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Minneapolis, MN) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: I received and invitation to do a phone screening interview the day after submitting my resume. The recruiter expressed that I would be a great candidate and will work on setting me up with another interview with the marketing team. I never heard back, not even an email. I continued to email every week, and checked my application status. A month later the opening finally closed. It is disappointing for an organization as big as HealthPartners to not take the time to respond. However, this also tells me that they may not be the company for me because of how they respond.
Interview Questions: Why are you looking for another job?

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Minneapolis, MN) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was lengthy and detailed. Multiple rounds. Moved through questions quickly. Best to be prepared to answer questions by pulling from specific scenarios, strategies applied/actions taken, and the positive outcome.
Interview Questions: What can you contribute to the discipline?

title: Copywriter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had a brief phone interview that went well, basically outlining my resume. I was then brought in for an in-person interview. Was basically a conversation about the responsibilities of the job. Everything went well, but then no call back. That to me is so completely unprofessional. Waste of my time.
Interview Questions: What's your favorite copy to write?

title: Clinical Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Saint Paul, MN)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, met with pharmacy manager then had a panel of pharmacists interview me.  Was overall very easy.  They called me within a few days and offered me a position.
Interview Questions: Describe how you multitask

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at HealthPartners
Interview Descriptions: very brief and easy.. first phone interview, then scheduled interview with manager. interview with manager was about an hour long. went through role in the clinic and talked about what is expected of the individual in the clinic.
Interview Questions: what will you bring to the team

title: Behavioral Health Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Minneapolis, MN)
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume, completed phone interview with very helpful person. Interviewed to direct supervisor and then the director of the department. Everyone was professional and respectful. Essentially 3 interviews were completed.
Interview Questions: Tell us of a difficult case or presentation of someone in need.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at HealthPartners
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview which is essentially a company's polite way of asking a large pool of candidates to explain why they should take the time to see them in person.
Interview Questions: The person conducting the phone interview asked the basic salary requirements and 'why are you leaving your current job/why do you want to work for us?' Then she opened it up for me to ask questions.

title: Compliance Auditor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: First let say that this place is for black women seems like all the positions there cater to the non -nurse phone woman which is fine... However my inter view was at 2:00 pm which everyone knows you are suppose to arrival 15 mins early didnt get interviewed till 3:15
Interview Questions: Director discuss the position over the phone and in the meeting how slow she was using share point she does know how so her degree is in business is a smack in the face if you dont know how to share your documents

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Inver Grove Heights, MN) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Job Interview very straight forward.  No trick questions. Was able to communicate without feeling uncomfortable.  Took tour of future employees, workspace, and was offered the job on the spot.  Hours were not negotiable so had to decline unfortunately.  Otherwise would have been an amazing opportunity.  They even invited me to stay for their company bbq they were having that day.
Interview Questions: Simple straight forward questions that did not catch you off guard.

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Anoka, MN)
Interview Descriptions: In person interview. I interviewed with two people for 45 minutes. total. They said they would get in touch with me multiple times after the interview for two weeks. I waited and never heard anything from them.
Interview Questions: Why did I choose this company

title: PA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at HealthPartners
Interview Descriptions: One hour laid back. Theyvgot to know you in depth. Ask about experience. Ask about clinicals. They spent a lot of time educating about the position and company logistics. Ask about your favorite specialties.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with diverse cultures

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Minneapolis, MN) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Quick. Simple. Straight to the point. Was referred by a friend, applied online and the friend sent an email to HR asking if they would consider me for a position. HR called me back within a week.
Interview Questions: Asked what my longterm goals were and if i plan to stay with the company?

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions:
1. Recruiter reached out to me for an initial 20-30 minute phone interview. 
2. Interviewed in-person with the hiring manager and the person I’d be working most closely with.
3. Interviewed in-person with 6 people including the director and two supervisors.
Interview Questions: What would your co-workers say about you?

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was long, but appropriate for the job. You start with a phone interview and then meet with 1-2 people you will be working directly with. Then, you go on to a group interview where you meet the entire team. This was way less formal and more fun personality type questions were asked, but it was still very much an interview. There is a writing test involved, but it is take home.
Interview Questions: Where do you get your news from?

title: Intern Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at HealthPartners
Interview Descriptions: Started with a phone interview, then was invited for an in person interview. Everyone was polite and clear about timelines and expectations throughout the interview process. In person interview included a few basic and behavioral interview questions. There was time to ask questions and the interviewers did a great job of explaining the internship and the goals of the company.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you went above and beyond the job requirements?

title: Research Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen with HR completed 2 weeks after I applied. In person interview 2 weeks later. 3 weeks went by and I emailed hiring manager and then HR. Invited back for 2nd in person interview 4 weeks later. It was a loonnnnnnggg process. In person interviews were conducted with a panel of 4-5 people, several of which were on a conference call, which was really challenging.
Interview Questions: What is the hardest feedback you've ever received?

title: Customer Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I got phone interview after i applied application through internet. After a few days, i got email that they want to phone interview first.  So, we made an appointment and i did it. After a couple of hours, I got face to face interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Actuarial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very professional, and everyone I interacted with was very nice and helpful.  First, there was a standard phone screen, which lead to an in person interview at their headquarters in Bloomington, MN.
Interview Questions: What were your favorite and least favorite classes in college?

title: Clinical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at HealthPartners in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Easy if you know someone internally.  no interview needed, just need to pass the medical terminology and typing test. However they will pick a temp. person over a new hire.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for HP?

title: Member Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions:
The overall interview process was great. 
They were extremely professional while also creating a very comfortable, welcoming environment. My interviewers were so personable and made me feel like I would fit in with the company culture. 
After the interview, I was given a tour around the office an
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you had to quickly solve a customer issue?

title: Clinical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Saint Paul, MN) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by a recruiter, went in for an in person interview. I was then offered another position and informed recruiter. Manager called me same day to say they wanted to offer me the position but good luck in my career path. Truly appreciate the gesture!
Interview Questions: How do I deal with a group of coworkers who are not all working up to par?

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at HealthPartners
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with company recruiter, then interviews with the boss. Second interview, met with the other team members and took a writing test. Took several weeks from applying to getting the job. Offer received and accepted.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: UNIX Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners
Interview Descriptions:
It started as a phone screening, then it went to the hiring manager and from there it was a 1:1
interview with a group panel at the end. Overall, the process was average.
Interview Questions: Typical behavioral questions.

title: Preclinical Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: A few weeks after the application deadline, I was emailed and offered a phone interview. The phone interview took about thirty minutes, with pretty standard interview questions with some focus on my interests and courses.
Interview Questions: What are three words that describe you?

title: Digital Marketing Analyst- Senior Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I met over coffee with the co worker of this role - we were connected via a mutual work friend. That went really well and he recommended I apply for this role. A few weeks later I was invited in to meet with the director. It seemed to go well and she trusted her employee's input that I would be a good fit. A few weeks after that I was invited in for multiple panel interviews. It was very intense rapid fire questions. There were 2 panels of 3 people each, then a less formal interview with the person I'd be working with and had already met with prior to the interview process. Unfortunately, the two panels asked me all the exact same questions! There was supposed to be a 3rd interview that day as well with a higher up, but they were out ill. It seemed like bit overkill and very exhausting.

The process took over two months. I was turned down for the role with zero feedback why. I was very surprised after the number of people I met with, and the tone during the interviews, that they couldn't be bothered to send a personal message and keep the bridge open for future roles.
Interview Questions: They wanted to know details of my technical Google Analytics experience

title: Senior Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: The whole process was very fast. The HR person was knowledgeable and was excellent with follow up.  I had a phone interview and two in person interviews. The first was with just the hiring manager and the 2nd was a group interview with 2 team members and the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: Describe to me your work style?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Minneapolis, MN) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was very laid back. I was very nervous at first but when we started the interview process it got a lot easier.  I was only asked a couple of questions and then got a outline of what I would be doing for the job
Interview Questions: What makes you a good person for our team?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: First you must submit an online application. Then an HR rep will give you a call to chat. If they like you and your previous experience, then you would get an in person interview with the hiring managers. If they like you, then you will be invited back to meet with senior marketers/planners. If they like you, then you will get the offer. However, the process is lengthy. I applied end of October, interview one was mid-November, interview two was mid-December and I was offered the job end of December.
Interview Questions: Explain a time when you made a marketing recommendation to a client that they didn't like. How did you respond?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone screen and then a panel interview process with the team.  The process from beginning to end lasted roughly 7 days or so.  The panel lasted 60 minutes and was focused on behavioral interview questions.
Interview Questions: Please tell us about your experience in Sourcing candidates.

title: Web Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at HealthPartners
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back phone screen interview just checking boxes and asking about your resume, why this company, why the industry, etc. The person on the other end was very professional and friendly and answered all of my questions. The position location was moved to a different location so I did not move forward.
Interview Questions: What made you choose the health care industry?

title: Member Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at HealthPartners in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was just a phone interview, no in person interview. They asked a lot of situational questions about your past customer service experience. Also asked about your experience with microsoft products. They also make people take a personality assessment, that they send over e-mail. Overall, the interview was pretty easy. Only took about 20 minutes.
Interview Questions:
Are you proficient with word, outlook, excel?

What is your customer service experience?

Name a time when you had to deal with a difficult customer and what you did about it?

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Richfield, MN) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions:
1. Phone Interview 30 minutes
2. Group Interview 1.5 hours

Phone interview: Answer common questions: Why are you interested in this role? Why are you looking for new job? 

Group Interview: Behavioral questions such as tell me a time you work on a challenging SQL project?
Interview Questions:
Behavioral questions
Technical questions related to Crystal report, Business Objects, SQL programming, EPIC

title: Human Resources Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at HealthPartners
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was scheduled for a phone interview about a week later. Then after about 3 weeks later when I almost gave up on it that I received an email invitation for on-site interview. Those questions are general, lots of behavioral questions though. They want to see if you truly fits in the nature of the role.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you delivered an exceptional customer service.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went very smooth. Staff was very positive and professional. Definitely good energy. I felt as though I landed the job as soon as I walked in. Excellent company to be apart of. I recommend this to anyone.
Interview Questions: I was asked what would you say is you weakness in the work setting

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN)
Interview Descriptions: First there was a phone interview, then about a week or so later, I went into the Bloomington office for an in person interview with the Director of Finance. I was told there would be no more interviews after this, and he would then make the decision. there was no panel interview.
Interview Questions: Why Health Partners? What can you bring to Health Partners? Past experience questions.

title: Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at HealthPartners
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview first for a quick background check then in person interview with the hiring manager. It was a laid back interview with the hiring manager. He asked about my background more in depth. Seemed very nice and friendly.
Interview Questions: Describe your past job experience

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Saint Paul, MN) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: An application was submitted online, then I was called by a recruiter and set up a phone interview. After the phone interview I got an email request for an in person interview.
Interview Questions: There were a lot of the "what would you do in BLANK situation?" questions

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Saint Paul, MN) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I responded to an online job board and was notified by phone for an interview.  My interview was via phone as well, and was facilitated by an HR representative.
Interview Questions: How will you contribute to this particular division?: Can you give examples of successful past projects? How do you handle crisis?

title: Appointment Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Three-step interview process. First is with the on-site recruiter. Second is with One of the main supervisors in the appointment center. Third is with the recruiter, all lead supervisors, and the head of the department. Challenging, but fair.
Interview Questions: Can you give us an example of something you may not have handled properly in your past work experience?

title: Member Services Representative Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email 3 days later to take an online assessment which took about 30 minutes to complete.   I had a phone interview with the HR recruiter a few days later,  went in to interview with 2 Member Services Supervisors and a manager 3 days after that, and had an offer 2 days later.  The whole process went pretty quickly and everyone that I had interaction with was very friendly and helpful.
Interview Questions: The interview questions were of the typical behavioural variety.

title: Human Resources Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Step-by-Step process: 

1st:  I received an email confirmation 2 weeks after applying for this position. I was contacted by the talent/ recruiting specialist to conduct a 60-90 minute phone interview. The specialist was very friendly and was able to provide a reasonable list of dates and times that were available to move to the next process. The phone interview went pretty well and the questions were quite basic. Overall, the experience was a “get to know you” and "how do you start your day". Everything lasted about 30-40 minutes. 
The specialist also asked my salary requirements and briefly went over the job summary which is very helpful to read (study) prior to the interview. I would also recommend printing that as well as your cover letter, resume, questions  as well as words or short sentences that highlight what you want to say just in case you get nervous and forget or if phone interviews are simply not your forte. 
 
2nd:  After the phone interview, I received a second confirmation the next day to conduct a second face-to-face interview with the lead manager the following week. Again, the specialist provided a variety of reasonable dates and times. I arrived 10 minutes early and I was able to check in with the receptionist whom seemed very friendly. I waited 5 minutes pass the interview time but I was in no rush, I figured I would use that time to relax a bit and clear my mind just so I can conduct myself more naturally without sounding too nervous. The manager came out very excited and genuine. I peeped out the atmosphere and it was cubical setting and obviously anyone in charge had a personal office. There were already employees observing me and were asking me if I were new, very kind people. We got to the managers office and that's when I was asked the million dollar question: “tell me about yourself”. From there everything went very smooth. I asked my two questions and after that, that concluded the interview. (Interview time: approximately 45 minutes)

3rd: That same day the specialist sent me an email but this time is was to conduct a third interview with a panel of 5 (which included the manager). The panel consists of a group of employees with different time in service but they all held the same position. It was at first intimidating but actually pretty interesting as I got to the questions. Most were ‘team’ based questions, past experience, my current job role, why did I choose HealthPartners, and sharing my personal experience with leading a group.
 I have to be honest, I was getting tired. I sort of felt like I was repeating myself and I was losing their interest. But I can tell they probably understood. The manager acted as a sort of an observer and would ask one or two follow up questions. Overall, this panel interview was not as scary as I was expecting but all the interviewers were very friendly and very interested.  

4th: Last, I received a phone call from the manager and offered me the position and went over pay and new hire orientation, and future advancement. Following that, I received and official letter from the specialist which provided all the necessary information prior to the new hire orientation.
Interview Questions: "How do you prioritize your work assignments?"

title: Health Informatics Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very low-key.  A friend of mine connected me with his manager for an informational interview before there were positions open.  I learned about the organizational culture and nature of the job.  Then, when a position opened within a few weeks, I applied right away.  A had a phone interview for basic screening/salary requirements, and then one day of in-person interviews with 3 managers on the team.  Questions were simple and focused more on my potential to learn the job and fit in with the team, rather than my hard skills.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience with SAS/SQL?

title: Dental Associate Underwriter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed over the phone with HR and then interviewed in person with the manager a second interview with the other members of management would have been the third step.
Interview Questions:
No difficult or unexpected question due to the boring use of following a template for personal, behavioral, questionnaire after the standard softening of the easier questions at the beginning with one question repeating from the HR questions.
The position as far as I can understand is for one to do mind numbing crunching, data entry, and verifying data. Throughout the in person interview my mind was going a mile a minute on ways to improve processes rather than what seemed to me very bulky and time wasting activities. And just like an interview before due to the improvements I could bring to existing processes I did not get the job. Just like for profits. For profits and non-profits would rather maintain their bulky time wasting activities rather than improve process for their internal/external customers.
I knew a week before the job was not mine as the position was re-posted a week before the official email was sent. Their loss and I wish them luck on finding some one to fill the position.

title: Member Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN)
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online via the HealthPartners website, took all of 15 minutes.  One week later I was contacted by someone in HR who informed me I would be receiving an email for an online assessment.  The assessment took some time to complete and seemed a bit unnecessary.  Two days later I received an email from HR about setting up a phone interview.  The phone interview lasted about 30 minutes and was very typical, "Tell me about a time when" questions.  I found it very simple and the person interviewing me was very friendly and even called me back after my cell phone dropped the call (oops!).  After the phone interview I was asked if I'd be interested in coming in for an interview.  I came in the next day and met with a wonderful Member Services manager.  The interview again was very simple and went smoothly.  I was then asked if I had time to meet with one other person.  That interview went quickly as well and felt really good.  It was a Tuesday and I was told I would hear either way by the end of the following week.

The following Monday I received a phone call from a Member Services Manager offering me the position, pending a background check.  The background check is rather simple compared to others I've had, it only verifies you graduated from high school (didn't even ask for any information relating to my bachelors degree) and it checks your criminal record.  5 days after I received an email from HealthPartners sayiing I successfully passed the background check.  Go me!  :-)
Interview Questions: First in person interview.  Describe how you would make a peanut butter and jelly sandwich!.

title: Triage RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at HealthPartners in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: started through temp agency with an easy interview process.  Went to office located in building and hired and working within 10 days  Hired on after six and a half  months with HP , easy transition to full time.
Interview Questions: An example of how you have gone "above and beyond" for a patient.  various triage questions and scenarios.     what is your greatest weakness as a nurse and what are your strengths.  nice people, comfortable space for interview.

title: Medical Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at HealthPartners
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview. They basically cut me off after I told them I have not been in the medical field for sometime and so ever wishing to get back into the field.
Interview Questions: How long has it been since you worked as a medical assistant or medical receptionist

title: Executive Assistant to Vice President of Talent Procurement Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Denver, CO) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed three times by phone from California by a wonderful sweet lady in HR who worked directly under the gentleman who needed the position filled. She felt I was THE candidate for the job. When I went for the final interview he and I got along well, he gave me a tour of the corporate headquarters where I would be working and the blank space (in the middle of a room full of cubicles? Right outside his corner office) where I'd be "set up." He and I went I to the outer room of his office (ummm... Perfect place for your gatekeeper?) and had a great interview. He seemed engaged and responded very positively to each if my answers. I asked questions about how my day might look, and his expectations. We left on good terms with a friendly smile and handshake. I felt like I aced the job and he kept saying "when you come on board..." 30 minutes after my interview his former assistant called to tell me he chose someone else. So we move forward and wait for the right one to come along!
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years

title: Marketing Communications Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Started with a phone interview and moved on to an in-person interview, which ended up being a few separate in-person interviews with various team members. The interviews were under 1 hour in length. The team was extremely friendly and put me at ease. Typical questions - no curve balls and even seemed interested in how my current work could help with their work.
Interview Questions: What is your working style?

title: Senior Desktop Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Inver Grove Heights, MN) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: HR refers hiring to department hiring manager.  Meet with team peers and manager and discuss job requirements.  Discussed the importance of customer service.  Discussed experience with equipment and the requirements of the position.
Interview Questions: Why do I feel you are qualified for this position?    Are you open to working a weekly on-call rotation?   Describe a time when you worked on a high priority issue and how did  you handle that situation to resolve it?

title: Marketing Communications Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners
Interview Descriptions: My first interview interaction for a phone interview with HR. Next I met the hiring manager in person for a one hour interview. The hiring manager asked great questions, but determined that I wasn't the greatest fit for the position I applied, but there was another opportunity within marketing that I should consider. The hiriting manager encouraged me to apply online, which I did later that day, and also forwarded my information to this other hiring manager. I was then scheduled for another one hour interview with the new hiring manager. The next step was a short interview with my potential new team members followed by an hour with the director of marketing. Things move quickly at HealthPartners, so I wasn't surprised to hear back from them less than a week later with an offer.
Interview Questions: One thing I really like about HealthPartners is their focus on culture.  The initial interview focused on the skills necessary for the desired position, but the following interview with team and director focused on the culture and if I'd be a good fit.

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Eden Prairie, MN) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I started with a phone interview, then I was moved onto the second interview which was face to face. I showed up early and the interview started about 6 minutes late. I interviewed with the supervisor of the department and the lead technician. It was easy going.
Interview Questions: I had the typical name your 3 strengths and weaknesses and why. What is a difficult decision you had to make at your last job? And the one that really stood out to me was on a scale of 1-10, 10 being he weirdest, how weird do you think you are and why?

title: Training Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at HealthPartners
Interview Descriptions: This feedback isn't really fair because I learned about the position and completed a phone interview with a recruiter who happened to be a long time friend.  The interview process with the hiring supervisor/manager was two-step.  First was a face-to-face formal, sit down. The second round was "presenting" or rather facilitating a training for a panel of staff.
Interview Questions: They didn't have any difficult questions but I was prepared for the most common questions.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at HealthPartners
Interview Descriptions:
Basic phone screening first – asked about previous work experiences, background, and education.

Phone screening was followed by an email inviting me to schedule an in-person interview at headquarters in Bloomington, MN.
Interview Questions: Standard questions about my experience and skill set.  Nothing out of the ordinary.

title: Member Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty simple. HR called me and interviewed me over the phone. After that Interview I got an in person interview. After that interview I had one more in person interview with two managers. Then I was offered the job.
Interview Questions: Explain in detail how you would make a pot of coffee?

title: Clinic Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Lots of questions regarding the treatment of patients and HIPPA policies, they conduct a panel interview which is a little intimidating, the hardest part is coming up with sufficient answers to the very complex questions on the spot.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you had to make a quick decision, where you confident in your decision? What was the end result?

title: Member Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I filled out the online application and immediately received a confirmation email as well as a link to an assessment that tested by mathematical reasoning and vocabulary. This test took about 30 minutes to complete. About a week later, I received an email from a recruiter stating that she would like to speak with me about the position over the phone the following week. We scheduled a date, and she called me that day at the exact scheduled time. I was unsure of whether or not this was going to be a "phone interview" or an informal conversation. It ended up being more of an interview - she gave me information about the company, asked me situational-behavioral questions, and asked me if I had any questions. (which I did) She then informed me that I was invited to come in for an onsite interview later that week. I Accepted and she emailed me a description of interview etiquette and what to do/where to go on interview day. I was instructed to bring a list of three professional references o the interview. My interview was two days later; I initially met with a supervisor of Member Services. He was extremely friendly and welcoming and seemed impressed with my qualifications. Again, he asked behavioral questions as well as spouted the benefits/perks of working for HealthPartners. This portion of the interview lasted about an hour. He then informed me that I would be moving on to the next stage in the process, and asked if I was willing to stay longer to speak with someone else. I was willing to stay, and next met with a hiring director who asked me a few more behavioral questions.  My meeting with her lasted approximately fifteen minutes. She then informed me that I would receive a hiring decision within the next week based on the results of my background and reference checks. Immediately after the interview, I emailed the first interviewer I spoke with and thanked him for his time and willingness to expand my interest in the company.

For the first time ever, I felt like I had this one in the bag. However, seventeen days went by with absolutely no updates or notifications. The "application status" online remained "interviewing process." On day 18, I emailed the supervisor I interviewed with and reiterated by interest in the company, asked for an update or if there were any supplemental materials materials that would be necessary. Within 20 minutes of sending that email, I received an email from the initial recruiter who contacted me stating that I was no longer in the running.

With the exception of the lengthy wait at the end of the process, I felt like their approach to hiring is was comfortable and professional. I have since re-applied for other similar positions with the company.
Interview Questions: The questions were not hard. Be prepared for the infamous, "Why HealthPartners?" question.

title: Billing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Saint Paul, MN) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Easy and quick.. Asked basic questions doe a behavioral interview.  Two supervisors in a conference room.  The whole process took about three weeks from start to finish.  Was contacted by Hr within a week after the in person interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us

title: Sustainability Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at HealthPartners in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Did a brief phone interview first. Very preliminary, I was asked about my previous work and education experiences, basically just expanded on what was included in the resume I included in my application. The next day I was sent an E-mail asking to schedule an in-person interview at headquarters in Bloomington, MN. I checked in to the front desk, got a badge and was sent up to meet with the sustainability manager, who was waiting for me. He escorted me to his office and began the interview. Nothing unexpected, the questions focused on how I would use my past experiences towards this job and how I'd handle certain situations. Questions included: How did you help promote sustainability/efficiency in past work? Are you comfortable in a diverse work environment where you will be out of the office often?  What would encourage/drive you to come to work every morning? How would you react to someone who is a very enthusiastic supporter of sustainability who insists you aren't doing enough? How would you react to someone who dismisses the concept of sustainability?
Interview Questions: "How would you know you've "made it" as a member of our team?"

title: Case Management Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: 3 levels of interview; phone, in person and second in person. Met with HR over the phone, the main hiring manger in person, and then the manager and director in person.
Interview Questions: Tell us a time you failed to meet a deadline

title: Buyer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at HealthPartners in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Initially contacted via email (my preference) to set up a phone interview. Interviewer was very nice and courteous throughout the entire interview. Unfortunately, they were looking for an immediate hire for the buyer position. I wasn't going to be able to start until 2-3 months down the road due to prior commitments. However, my interviewer did inform me of a possible future opening around the time I would be available. Overall, great interview... timing just didn't work out in my case.
Interview Questions: I was asked about salary expectations during the intial phone interview which I was not expecting and honestly not prepared for.

title: Clinic Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Saint Paul, MN)
Interview Descriptions: Took a long time to get through the online screening. Had to apply to a job far below my qualifications. Interviewer had me waiting 30mins. Brief interview.
Interview Questions: Why are you applying to a job below your qualifcations?

title: Pharmacy Audit Quality Compliance Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied to the position on the company's website. Was contacted by HR within a few days. Had a phone interview with the HR recruiter a few days afterwards. Was contacted after the phone interview to come in for an in person interview with the two hiring supervisors and director. Was invited for a second interview with the two hiring supervisors.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite kind of sandwich?

title: Web Content Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at HealthPartners in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had one interview by phone. I talked with a key person on the team that I would ended up being placed with. I was called back within a couple days.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Took about 45 minutes. Questions were general; they asked about what you do, your skills and what you can bring to the table. This was a panel interview with 4 people involved. But overall very relaxed interview.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you came up with a process that benefited your company

title: Web Developer/SQL Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I found an open position on their careers page.  Two days later, I was contacted by an internal recruiter who asked me some basic behavioral questions.  She was extremely friendly and told me about the wonderful benefits of HealthPartners.  Two days later, I had an interview with two managers.  They had asked me typical questions, "What was your favorite project?  What was your least favorite project?" Stuff, like that.  They too were very positive,  non intrusive and had a nice sense of humor in the interview.  Two days later I had a panel interview with 7 people.  They ranged from employees at a director level, down to a few developers.  Honestly,  it wasn't scary at all.  They made me feel very comfortable,  and I could tell that this team genuinely enjoyed working with each other.   They extended an offer to me the day after this interview.  So within two weeks of applying online,  I had done three interviews, and accepted an offer.
Interview Questions: There weren't too many difficult questions.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at HealthPartners
Interview Descriptions: Standard behavioral questions. Never received response after interview.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at HealthPartners
Interview Descriptions: 2-3 met with direct supervisor, director and staff supervising.  Great staff!!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: IS&T Technical Project Manager Senior Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN)
Interview Descriptions: HealthPartners has a network hiring preference.  It's much more likely to get a job at HealthPartners if you know a current employee.
Interview Questions: The questions vary widely by hiring manager.  There isn't a specified format.

title: Marketing Communications Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Minneapolis, MN) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got a call from HR to request a phone interview a week or two later. After the phone interview I was asked to come in and interview with the hiring manager. This interview was a lot to do with what I know to determine if I could get the work den. The final step was an interview with the Director of the department and a meet and greet with the team I'd be working with. This final interview was more about how I'd fit into the culture.
Interview Questions: Explain your strengths and weaknesses and how they'd benefit the work you'd do at HealthPartners.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Applied for the internship position 5 days after it was posted online. Received a phone interview offer about a week later which took about one week to set up.  

The phone interview was difficult to prepare for as there was little information listed in the job description for the internship and the staffing specialist seemed to not quite know how to explain what I'd be responsible for which was problematic as most of the interview consisted of "describe how your background most prepares you for this position." 

 After the interview I had followed up with the staffing specialist who said I had a great resume for the position and two weeks later received another message from HR stating that the company had chosen an individual who applied earlier in the hiring process.  Overall it was a rather negative experience and the company did little to keep me informed of their hiring timeline.
Interview Questions: Describe what you have done in the past that would prepare you for the position.

title: IT Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Once you submit your application you have an initial interview with an HR Recruiter.  Then you get an interview with the hiring manager and the whole team.
Interview Questions: How do you set expectations for the business

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied at the suggestion of a current employee. Sent my resume and cover letter via company web page. Recieved a request for a phone screenign with HR. After phone screen was completed was invited to meet with the hiring manager who conducted a routine interview. I was then asked back for a second interview with team of individuals including supervisors, direct staff and managers. Recieved an offer from hiring manager a week after final interview.
Interview Questions: Typical questions, explain your background, explain your leadership style, give examples of time when you delt with conflict.

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: I found the position online and applied. I heard back about a week later. The interview process was pretty straightforward and was mostly personality based questions. Round 1 was a phone interview with the hiring manager. Round 2 was an interview with three potential coworkers followed by interview with hiring manager. I got along very well with both the team and the hiring manager. I received an offer a week later and accepted.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question was describing difficult work situations in my past.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Minneapolis, MN) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: I have one phone interview with the HR recruiter after submitting my application online.  Then I had one in person interview with the hiring supervisor and then another interview with the hiring supervisor and her immediate supervisor.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Health Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview process went great. I did not end up getting the job probably due to experience but everyone was very professional. I was a new graduate just out of college with only internship experience and no paid position experience.
Interview Questions: How can your skills help us as a company?

title: Customer Service Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Although I am not a seasoned interviewee, I felt that the personnel interviewing me went out of their way to make the experience uncomfortable. I am trying to maintain perspective but the truth is they were barely polite from the moment I met them. I distinctly got the impression that I wasn't even in the running before we even began. Like I said I don't have much of a benchmark for interviews, but I sure hope my next experiences are more positive. HealthPartners is supposed to be a great company to work for. Perhaps I just caught them on a bad day.
Interview Questions: Name a time that you benefited from constructive criticism.

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Three interview are taken .1)HR
2)Hiring manger
3)Technical and director
Interview Questions: Interview was not that difficult

title: Call Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Long interview process starting through temp agency.  Then converting to regular employee.  Panel interviews with supervisors.  Started with phone interview, then panel interview, then 1:1 supervisor interview.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Director, Facility Development & Space Planning Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: They called and requested we set-up a phone interview.  A few days later they contacted me at the agreed interview time.  The HR person asked me a number of predetermined questions for about 45 minutes.  My interview was in February 2010 - to date (May), the position is still open and no follow-up interview has been scheduled.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at HealthPartners (Bloomington, MN) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the intern position online and was called back for an interview. The interview was conducted with two people (one main interviewer and one scribe). The interview consisted of really basic interview questions (weaknesses, strengths, etc). The interview was conducted on time and only took about 30 minutes. The interviewer could definitely tell I was pretty nervous but really helped me to calm down. Overall, a great experience.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses/strengths?
